issue.title: Ign msgs2 cannot find Protobuf on Ubuntu Xenial

content.raw:
I figured out why we're inconsistent.

I'm using cmake-3.11 on my Xenial machine, and the `FindProtobuf.cmake` file that comes with cmake-3.11 creates the imported targets. That's why my machine is getting the imported protobuf targets, even though I'm using protobuf-2.6.1. I'll figure out a way to patch this.

I'm guessing the reason it passed the pipelines CI is because the pipelines were using the older version of ign-cmake, which just ignored the `COMPONENTS` part of the `ign_find_package(~)` call.
content.html:
I figured out why we're inconsistent.

I'm using cmake-3.11 on my Xenial machine, and the FindProtobuf.cmake file that comes with cmake-3.11 creates the imported targets. That's why my machine is getting the imported protobuf targets, even though I'm using protobuf-2.6.1. I'll figure out a way to patch this.

I'm guessing the reason it passed the pipelines CI is because the pipelines were using the older version of ign-cmake, which just ignored the COMPONENTS part of the ign_find_package(~) call.
